title: Patriots OC Josh McDaniels takes some accountability for team’s goal line struggles
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots However, McDaniels also stressed the importance of execution on the plays that the Patriots failed to score on in their win over the Bengals.
Josh McDaniels and Drake Maye have a good Year 1 together, but there is one area they've struggled to solve.

(Winslow Townson/AP Images for Panini) By Conor Roche November 28, 2025 | 3:49 PM 2 minutes to read Drake Maye joked that he would be willing to take a whiff of smelling salts in order to help the Patriots end their goal line woes.

title: Police investigating series of Somerville break-ins
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Crime The break-ins took place between Nov.
22 and Nov.
23 along Harold, Wyatt, and Dimick streets, according to police.

title: Celtics center Amari Williams earns praise from Jaylen Brown in his NBA debut
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics "That was impressive from Amari, I'm not going to lie.
" Amari Williams played in his first professional game Wednesday night against the Pistons (Erin Clark/Globe Staff).
While the Celtics are missing their starting center Neemias Queta with an ankle injury, they seem to have found a suitable replacement.

title: 24-year-old dead after crash in Yarmouth
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Authorities responded to a crash early Thanksgiving morning on West Yarmouth Road.
A 24-year-old man was killed in a car crash in Yarmouth early Thanksgiving morning, according to local officials.
Police responded to the location of the crash at 1:13 a.

title: How the Patriots’ odds to win division, get No. 1 seed in AFC can improve in Week 13
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots control their own destiny in the AFC East race, while they might need some help down the line to get the No.
1 seed in the AFC.
Mike Vrabel and the Patriots are 10-2 entering their Week 13 matchup against the Giants.

title: Review & setlist: The Lemonheads lack rudder, any cohesive sound in return to Boston
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Concert Reviews Whatever spark might have fueled the harshed-mellow power pop that helped make Evan Dando the bad boyfriend of early-'90s alternative rock was long gone, replaced by a ragged cipher.
Boston band The Lemonheads.
Gareth Jones By Marc Hirsh November 28, 2025 | 2:13 PM 4 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: David Pastrnak day-to-day with injury as Bruins lineup takes another hit

David Pastrnak will miss his first game since the 2021-22 season on Friday.

title: Home explodes in Maine, injuring one
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News A home in Oakland, Maine, was leveled in a Thanksgiving Day explosion, officials said.
Crews responded Thursday after a house exploded in Oakland, Maine.
Office of Maine State Fire Marshal A house exploded in Maine on Thanksgiving, injuring one person and spreading debris throughout a residential neighborhood.
